title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Samaritan Health Services in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Doing application process they asked for your Social Security number, drivers license, date of birth in order to do not just a background check but also a credit check. It had paperwork about the fair credit reporting act.

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Samaritan Health Services in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Began with phone call with recruiter then casual phone call with medical director. This was followed by in-person tour and reviewing benefit package at site then ended with small panel (5 including candidate) interview at the hospital.
Interview Questions: How do you react to stress?

title: Senior HR Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Samaritan Health Services (Corvallis, OR) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: For this role, Samaritan Health Services had a three-stage interview process.  It began with a telephone interview, an interview with peers and the hiring manager, and with executives. I did not participate n the final interview as I had already received a job offer from a different firm.
Interview Questions: The interview questions were standard behavioral questions as well as questions about my background.

title: Business Analyst I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Samaritan Health Services
Interview Descriptions:
The initial zoom interview was straightforward. The interviewer is one of your supervisors and my interviewer was very forthcoming with information pertaining to what the job would look like and what they are looking for in their potential candidates. 
The second interview was with HR over the phone. I was asked about my previous job history for the last 10 years, with information about how long I was there for and why I left. 
Finally, they asked for references (at least three and at most five). Samaritan Health Services uses an online platform to digitally send and receive references, though you are unable to go back and change information about the recommendation given or the information about the person being the reference.
Interview Questions:
What is your experience with Excel?
What do you hope to learn from this position?
What is your experience with SQL?

title: Training Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Samaritan Health Services (Salem, OR) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: First initial phone interview, and after clearing that hurdle a virtual, group, interview. While virtual, everyone was warm and engaged, and the process was a positive experience. The interview consisted of the usual round of situational-based questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time where you were responsible for creating and delivering training content (two separate answers).

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Samaritan Health Services
Interview Descriptions: Talked about customer service and past employment. Talked about job description. Took a tour of the hospital. It took about an hour. Wasn't asked many questions at all. They were nice though.

title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Samaritan Health Services (Newport, OR) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Quick, painless and no stupid questions. The recruiter went over the job and the environment I’d be working. Overall a nice conversation about what they were looking for, type of training available and other opportunities.
Interview Questions: What was your last nursing job like

title: Customer Service Representative I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Samaritan Health Services (Corvallis, OR) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by 3 an immediate supervisor, a secondary supervisor and a trainer. Each took turns asking a question; all took notes. All 3 were very pleasant and professional. I felt very comfortable with the persons interviewing me. The interview questions were similar to others found online and this was helpful in preparing for the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us what makes you well suited for this position?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Samaritan Health Services (Albany, OR) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: A long online process, then an online questionnaire, after the recruiting company reviewed it was forwarded onto the manager who then requested an interview.  I was offered the next day
Interview Questions:
What makes you want to work for us?
We have a smaller hospital, is that something that you would be able to work with (i came from a much larger system)
Few clinical questions, difficult patient and family questions, pretty standard questions

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Samaritan Health Services (Corvallis, OR) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by two supervisors. I was able to talk with the previous Intern before and after the interview which was very helpful. The interview lasted approximately 20 minutes.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
Describe a time when you had to work with a team.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Samaritan Health Services (Corvallis, OR) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Got called in for interview with Manager and Supervisor.  Got a call the next day asking me to come in and meet with Chief Operating Officer.  She asked me very specific questions that a person would have to have been working at Samaritan to answer.  She seemed to want me to fail the interview, which I did.  I have so much valuable experience, but this company will not give you the opportunity to show that talent if you don't know what they want to hear.  Being a genuine hard working, knowledgable, reliable person doesn't matter if you are not a game player.  So, brush up on those behaviorial interview answers and tell them what they want to hear.
Interview Questions: Easy, but if you are honest, you will probably fail.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Samaritan Health Services (Corvallis, OR) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: So many red flags. No one seems happy to be there. Have been through three interviews (two different positions). Each time, the process was extremely disorganized and excruciatingly slow. I'm female and the men on the panels (except for one) came across as sexist, dismissive, threatened, and socially inept, both towards me and towards my female interviewers. Won't be applying for any more positions; I've seen enough.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? (Same question I asked myself after the last interview...)

title: Infusion Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Samaritan Health Services (Corvallis, OR) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with human resources . Then second phone interview with manager. Then had a walk through of the infusion center, met with some key staff members. Took a tour of the building and had discussion with the manager.
Interview Questions: What is the reason you want this job.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Samaritan Health Services (Corvallis, OR) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview panel, critical thinking questions. Unclear upon hiring for process of submitting education requirements to HR and unclear inconsistent union representation/presentation. I personally don't feel interview panel and critical thinking questions are helpful as they stress out the interviewee.

title: Unit Support Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Samaritan Health Services (Lebanon, OR) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. HR called same week for an interview. I was interviewed by 2 people. Within a week of the interview, I received an email with an automated message saying another candidate was chosen.
Interview Questions: What are your strength and weakness?

title: Nurse Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Samaritan Health Services
Interview Descriptions: Interview with department manager, member of senior leadership, HR Director
Interview Questions: What sets off your hot button

title: RN Clinic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Samaritan Health Services (Corvallis, OR) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Application is online for all positions. I had 5 interviews and at each one there were two individuals present. They have a list of questions their company asks you during their interview and of course since some jobs are union if you are coming from outside of the company you will not be chosen. They were all very good questions. Each person was kind and professional, clean and well spoken. All questions I asked during the my questions possed to them were answered to the best of their ability and to my satisfaction. The only rule here is hat like most companies these days, when they don't hire you then you are e-mail. This is so impersonal and leaves many prospecive employees feeling very lost and somewhat used.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question for me was, " do you have any questions for us?"

title: Medical Records Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Samaritan Health Services (Albany, OR) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: A group interview with my potential manager and direct coworkers who all asked questions to learn about my adaptability, attention to detail, self motivation and team spirit.     Displaying sf confidence, communicating details and past incidences that were relevant, and remembering names got me the job.
Interview Questions: How have you improved the last workplace you were employed at?
